name: Paquimé Archaeological Zone
description: A fascinating archaeological site showcasing the ruins of an ancient pre-Hispanic city, recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Museum of Northern Cultures
description: A museum displaying artifacts and exhibits related to the Paquimé culture and other ancient cultures of northern Mexico.

name: Cueva de las Monas
description: A cave with ancient rock paintings dating back thousands of years, located near the city of Chihuahua.

name: Cumbres de Majalca National Park
description: A national park with stunning rock formations, ideal for hiking and nature observation.

name: Hacienda de San Diego
description: A restored historic hacienda offering a glimpse into rural life and the history of the region.

name: Cerro de la Campana
description: An iconic hill with panoramic views of the city and its surroundings, perfect for a short hike.

name: Santa Eulalia Mine
description: An ancient mine that played a significant role in the region's mining history, located a short distance from Nuevo Casas Grandes.

name: Laguna de Bustillos
description: A lagoon surrounded by natural landscapes, ideal for birdwatching and outdoor activities.
